definition: a surface luster or brightness : shine

examples: selfishness that had a gloss of humanitarianism about it

definition: a transparent cosmetic preparation for adding shine and usually color to the lips
to mask the true nature of : give a deceptively attractive appearance to
examples: the misery was general, where not glossed over by liberal application of alcohol

definition: to deal with (a subject or problem) too lightly or not at all
examples: glosses over scholarly controversies rather than confronting them head-on

definition: a brief explanation (as in the margin or between the lines of a text) of a difficult or obscure word or expression
a false and often willfully misleading interpretation (as of a text)
a continuous commentary accompanying a text
to provide a gloss for : explain, define
to dispose of by false or perverse interpretation
examples: trying to gloss away the irrationalities of the universe
